channel.title: Help ASAP!
channel.description: Okay, Will Someone Actruly Read And Comment Now...? How Do I Make It Where A Item I Click On Give's You RANDOM Items Not Just 1 Items And Not All The Items? And This Is For PI! Not No Shitty Delta... (If Your Coding Delta STOP Now And Go To PI!!!)

item.title: Help ASAP!
item.dc:creator: @Abandoned_Dreams Abandoned Dreams
item.description:
@Abandoned_Dreams wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”][quote author=Abandoned Dreams link=topic=471931.msg3451504#msg3451504 date=1293769820]
Okay, Thanks To Both Of You, I Vain I You Showed Me What A Array Was And Evocation You Got Me The Code And What File To Put Them In And Where… Eather Way I Will Know How To Do It Next Time… Thanks Guys (I Would Rep++ But Obv. I Am New.)
[/quote]Since you’re new, you should learn early: Rep means nothing. It’s a stupid number system that is abused way to much. If you want to be popular, or looked up to, learn how to do stuff, and help people / release stuff for the community’s best interest.

If you just want rep to be popular, cool, or whatever people tie rep to, then forget it.[/quote]Then Why The Hell Do They Have Rep On Here Thats Kinda Stupid…

Read full topic

item.title: Help ASAP!
item.dc:creator: @Evocation Evocation
item.description:
@Evocation wrote:

[quote=“Abandoned Dreams, post:7, topic:375997”][quote author=I Vain I link=topic=471931.msg3451441#msg3451441 date=1293767298]
His method is the same thing, except it makes you have a certain item for it.

I was trying to teach you how to do it, when all he did was provide a method.

Would you rather be spoon-fed, or learn?
[/quote]Learned, But Honestly His Was Kinda More Help Full Because He Gave Me Where To Put It In That File And What File, I Like When You Help Because You Replace What I Can Change Like you Did With “ITEM” and “ARRAY_NAME”[/quote]I Apologize I Vain I. Though to be honest, your first post here was basically about arrays. how do you expect him to know what an array is off the bat?
@Abandoned, go into clickitem.java search for if (c.getHerblore().isUnidHerb(itemId)) c.getHerblore().handleHerbClick(itemId); above it add

if(itemId == 6199) { c.givereward(); }

Read full topic

Okay Now, Can You Do Your Post Again But With More Detail Of Telling Me Where To Put It, What File How To Get To That File, And Anything I Can Replace Please Color It If You Can Take The Time But If Thats 2 Long Then Okay.

item.title: Help ASAP!
item.dc:creator: @Abandoned_Dreams Abandoned Dreams
item.description:
@Abandoned_Dreams wrote:

[quote=“Evocation, post:4, topic:375997”]Go into client.java search for Public Void FlushOutStream Right above it add this:

public void givereward() { if (getItems().playerHasItem(6199)) { getItems().deleteItem(6199, 1); getItems().addItem(randomlottery(), 1); } else sendMessage("You need 2 free slots."); } public static int randomlottery[] = {15000, 15001, 15002, 15003, 15004, 15005, 15006, 15007, 15008, 15009, 15010, 15011, 15012, 15013, 15014, 15015, 15016, 15017, 15018, 15019, 15020, 11694}; public static int randomlottery() { return randomlottery[(int) (Math.random() * randomlottery.length)]; }
Go into click item.java and search for if (c.getHerblore().isUnidHerb(itemId)) c.getHerblore().handleHerbClick(itemId); Above it add:
if(itemId == 6199) {
c.givereward();
}[/code] Save, Compile, Restart[/quote]So I Can Just Use This Whole Code? And Also What File Do I Put This In???
Go into click item.java and search for [code=] if (c.getHerblore().isUnidHerb(itemId))
c.getHerblore().handleHerbClick(itemId); Above it add:
if(itemId == 6199) {
c.givereward();
}Save, Compile, Restart[code=]

Read full topic

item.title: Help ASAP!
item.dc:creator: @Abandoned_Dreams Abandoned Dreams
item.description:
@Abandoned_Dreams wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]Yes that’s it.

You need an array of items, here’s one in basic terms;

public int ARRAY_NAME[] = {ITEM, ITEM, ITEM, ITEM};

public int randomARRAY() {
    return ARRAY_NAME[(int) (Math.random() * ARRAY_NAME.length()];
}

If you want items, with amounts, we need a two-dimensional array, such as

public int ARRAY_NAME[][] = {{ITEM, AMOUNT}, {ITEM, AMOUNT}, {ITEM, AMOUNT}};

public int randomARRAY() {
    return ARRAY_NAME[(int) (Math.random() * ARRAY_NAME.length()][1];
}

Not sure if the second one is written correctly, I kinda guessed at it. :S[/quote]How Do I Get A “ARRAY” ??
And Also The 2nd Part Of His Message Is That “clickingMost.java” Or “Item.java” Or “ClickingItem.java” ???

Read full topic

item.title: Help ASAP!
item.dc:creator: @Evocation Evocation
item.description:
@Evocation wrote:

Go into client.java search for Public Void FlushOutStream Right above it add this:

public void givereward() { if (getItems().playerHasItem(6199)) { getItems().deleteItem(6199, 1); getItems().addItem(randomlottery(), 1); } else sendMessage("You need 2 free slots."); } public static int randomlottery[] = {15000, 15001, 15002, 15003, 15004, 15005, 15006, 15007, 15008, 15009, 15010, 15011, 15012, 15013, 15014, 15015, 15016, 15017, 15018, 15019, 15020, 11694}; public static int randomlottery() { return randomlottery[(int) (Math.random() * randomlottery.length)]; }
Go into click item.java and search for if (c.getHerblore().isUnidHerb(itemId)) c.getHerblore().handleHerbClick(itemId); Above it add:

if(itemId == 6199) { c.givereward(); } Save, Compile, Restart

Read full topic

item.title: Help ASAP!
item.dc:creator: @Abandoned_Dreams Abandoned Dreams
item.description:
@Abandoned_Dreams wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]src/server/model/players/PlayerAssistant

Please learn the packaging before attempting to code it. ^^[/quote][code] public static int Barrows[] = {4708, 4710, 4712, 4714, 4716, 4718, 4720, 4722, 4724, 4726, 4728, 4730, 4732, 4734, 4736,

4738, 4745, 4747, 4749, 4751, 4753, 4755, 4757, 4759};
public static int Runes[] = {4740,558,560,565};
public static int Pots[] = {};

public int randomBarrows() {
	return Barrows[(int)(Math.random()*Barrows.length)];
}

public int randomRunes() {
	return Runes[(int) (Math.random()*Runes.length)];
}

public int randomPots() {
	return Pots[(int) (Math.random()*Pots.length)];
}[/code]that? and i would normaly just use search thing in top right but its not working atm...

Read full topic

item.title: Help ASAP!
item.dc:creator: @Abandoned_Dreams Abandoned Dreams
item.description:
@Abandoned_Dreams wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]PI is just as bad as Delta. ^^

Anyway, you need to create an array of items, and an integer to return a random item from the array.

PI came with three by default. I believe they are in PlayerAssistant.

Search around for barrows.[/quote]How Do I Get To “PlayerAssistant” ?
